section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary) to receive notification of remittances, and subsequent updates, from the Remitting Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The guide uses the terms "IR" and "Inward Remittance interchangeably.
The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Inward Remittance Landing Page
section.para: The Inward Remittance Landing page displays a list of IRs that are in various stages of an IR life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement. List of available views are shown in Default View dropdown.
The following image illustrates the Inward Remittance landing page:

The IR dashboard segregates transactions based on their current status like draft, awaiting authorization, awaiting response from client or bank, approved by bank, rejected or purged from bank. The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual IRs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Draft
Lists all the IRs in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing Inward Remittance transactions that are awaiting client approval.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Inward Remittance transactions that are awaiting bank approval.
Active
Lists all the approved Inward Remittance records by the bank.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Inward Remittance records by the bank. The status given to such IRs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the Inward Remittance transactions that have been marked as purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Entity, Beneficiary Name, Currency and Expiry Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant IRs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed IRs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of IRs
CSV Download: Download the list of IR transactions displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed IRs.

section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Click on Inward Remittance Landing button at the top of Details page to navigate back to Inward Remittance Landing page.
Click on Journey button at the top of Details page to view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
In case an action is pending on the corporate user, a Respond button is present against the stated event, that navigates user to screen to perform the respective action.
Additional Information: Lists the 'Attachments' added as part of this transaction and also displays 'Documents' and 'Fees and Charges' details.
